thread.title: Comment on Naika Venant: 5 Fast Facts You Need to Know by Frank Nichol Sr
thread.title_full: Comment on Naika Venant: 5 Fast Facts You Need to Know by Frank Nichol Sr

author: Frank Nichol Sr
title: Comment on Naika Venant: 5 Fast Facts You Need to Know by Frank Nichol Sr
text:
Naika Venant: 5 Fast Facts You Need to Know Published Updated 10:13 am EDT, March 14, 2017 13 Comments By Jessica McBride 27.7k Share Tweet Follow Nakia Venant. (Facebook) 
A Florida teenager known for her big smile and desire to write a book some day hanged herself on Facebook Live inside a Miami foster home. 
Naika Venant, 14, is one of three people to commit suicide on Facebook Live in the past month. (Some major news sites give Venantâ€™s first name as Nakia and others as Naika. However, many Florida-based news outlets say the girlâ€™s name was spelled Naika.) 
Venantâ€™s own mother, Gina Caze, is now accused of having â€œwatched and written messages on her estranged 14-year old daughterâ€™s social media post accusing her of seeking attention and crying wolf,â€ the Sun reports . The news site says Cazeâ€™s lawyer denies she saw the suicide, though. 
A few weeks before, a 12-year-old in Georgia, Katelyn Nicole Davis, killed herself on Facebook Live, and an aspiring Hollywood actor, Jay Bowdy , did the same this week. 
Hereâ€™s what you need to know: 1. The Horrific Live Video Streamed For Two Hours Naika Venant. (Facebook) 
In the tragic video, Naika wrote, â€œI Donâ€™t Wanna Live No More,â€ and added â€œthree sad-faced emojis,â€ the Associated Press reported. 
Naika committed suicide by hanging herself in the bathroom at the foster home where she was staying, according to the New York Daily News. The newspaper reported that Naikaâ€™s friends said her suicide played out online. 
The live stream â€œshowed the teen using a scarf to make a homemade noose,â€ the Daily News reported. The girl used the name â€œHothead Nikeeâ€ on Facebook. 
At least one friend called police, but by the time they arrived, it was too late, according to Teen Vogue . 
Another friend wrote on Facebook, â€œSIP my loveâ€¦ You will always and forever be my Diamond ğŸ’. To all of you that mocked her as I watched her take her last breathâ€¦ God still loves youâ€¦ I pray that He unhardens your heart.â€ 2. Venantâ€™s Motherâ€™s Attorney Accuses the System of Not Getting Her Proper Help 
According to the Sun-Sentinel , Howard M. Talenfeld, president of the Floridaâ€™s Children First advocacy group, and an attorney for Venantâ€™s mother, said in a press conference Wednesday that â€œcase workers knew Naika had serious mental health problems.â€ 
The newspaper quoted the attorney as saying that the â€œcourts had ordered intensive therapyâ€ and she was hospitalized â€œafter it was determined she was a danger to herself.â€ 
However, she was released. After Naikaâ€™s death, the secretary of the Florida Department of Children & Families told The Miami Herald : â€œWe are absolutely horrified and devastated by the news of this young girlâ€™s death.â€ 
As the video streamed, concerned and shocked friends wrote comments on Naikaâ€™s wall. Although the video is no longer there, some of the comments remain. 
Among them, â€œIâ€™m not sure if u really killed yaself but imma let u know thatâ€™s not how u solve yo problems baby girl fr if u kill yourself donâ€™t think u gone be in a better place cause your not your gonna wish u never killed yo self onnareal fr donâ€™t do that dumb shiii ğŸ˜¢ğŸ˜’ğŸ˜’ğŸ˜”ğŸ˜”.â€ 3. The Teen Was Sexually Abused in Foster Care (Facebook) 
Naika was sexually abused in foster care by a teenage boy, according to the Miami Herald , which reported she was placed in foster care because, her motherâ€™s attorney said, of alleged excessive â€œcorporal punishmentâ€ by the mother. 
Naika had also run away from home, the newspaper reported. 
Another friend shared a chilling conversation on Facebook: 
Another friend wrote, â€œPolice was at my house I gave them her name but they said on the thing they know were she at they just left my crib ig the found the foster home she at.â€ 
And another implored Naika: â€œYou need to answer these people if you are alive.â€ 4. Naika Had Been Shuttled Among Ten Foster Homes A photo Naika Venant posted on Facebook. 
Venantâ€™s attorney said the troubled teenager had been shuffled from foster home to foster home â€“ as many as 10, according to the Associated Press. 
She was in foster care for half her life, the AP reported. 
Police might have gotten to Naika on time but the friend who called them gave them the wrong address, the Miami Herald reported , adding that the foster parents were asleep when the suicide occurred around 3 a.m. 5. Naika Was Described as a Smart 8th Grader Who Hoped to Write a Book Naika Venant. (Facebook) 
Despite the struggles in her life, those who knew Naika described the teenâ€™s potential. 
A family friend told the Miami Herald that Naika was â€œsmart academicallyâ€ with a big smile and charisma and â€œher dream was to write a book on her life.â€ 
Naikaâ€™s sister wrote on her Facebook page, â€œThis Is Nike Sister Iâ€™m Not Answering Any Calls Stop Calling Yes Nike Passed Away This Morning Im Logged Into Her Facebook There Has Been No Information Given About A Funereal I Will Announce If Anything Come Up â€“ Big Sis â¤â€ 
On Facebook, the teen had posted several other Facebook Live videos in recent months, many of them filled with music, her making expressive faces at the camera, and some of them quite lengthy. You can see them here.
